definition: to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The realm of reproductive technology is unusually laissez-faire in the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 在美國對待輔助生育技術的濫用持放任自流的態度。

sentences.english: Don't tell Jim how to discipline his children. Leave well enough alone.
sentences.chinese: 不必告訴吉姆怎麼管學孩子，放任自流吧。

sentences.english: If the efficient market hypothesis were valid, there would be an a priori reason for imposing no constraints.
sentences.chinese: 假如有效市場假說有效，放任自流就存在先驗理由。

definition: to take a laissez-faire attitude
to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
lit. to smash a cracked pot (idiom); crazy despair in the face of a blemish, defect, error or setback
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 yan3

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to turn a blind eye
pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
easy-going/lax/unconstrained/unruly
to indulge/to pamper/to connive at/permissive/indulgent/self-indulgent/unrestrained/undisciplined/uncultured/boorish
